alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 3:16PM MST until August 13 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following counties, Cochise and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 615 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 316 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms to the east of Elgin have produced between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain. Rainfall runoff will rapidly drain into the Babocomari River resulting in a small stream flooding along the Babocomari as it flows east into southwest Cochise county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huachuca City, Elgin and Fort Huachuca. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
